abstract: Brooklyn Community Services, one of the charities supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Tyson Fabers, who suffers from schizoaffective disorder, pay for classes and fees to regain his commercial driver’s license.
lead_paragraph: Tyson Fabers heard voices that compelled him toward violence and self-medication. Now he is working to regain the commercial driver’s license he lost while hospitalized.

headline.main: Silencing the Inner Torment, a Brooklyn Man Finds a Way Forward
headline.print_headline: Learning to Quiet Voices That Once Plagued Him
